intro: Rhododendron nudipes subsp. niphophilum, commonly known as the alpine rhododendron, is a species native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense, dark green foliage. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil and partial shade. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
